description: 3/4 length portrait of a woman seated in a red upholstered chair; she holds a fan and wears a black dress with black lace shawl; red drapery hangs behind to her right; gold frame; gold frame
inscription:
Signature, Inscription and Sticker

verso, written in black marker in large lettering on Kraft paper: [Married John William / Lived at Leighton Plantation / Thibodaux, Louisiana

Daughter Cornelia, married Thomas Winder; their daughter, Lou, / married Lewis Hardy Allen in Los Angeles, 1911. Their daughter Cornelia  married Roy A. Doty in Durham, N.C. 1937. 

Painted by William Baker, 1852. / He lived 1825-1875. Studio at 183 Canal Street New Orleans until 1865; / moved studio to N.Y.

Restored by Leo Marzolo, Chicago, 1961]
markings: verso, typed on white sticker at upper L corner: [Restored by Mrs. Georgette Grosz / 4100 Marine Dr., Chicago Ill. 60613 / JAN. 1968 (written in blue ink)]
title: Portrait of Louise McGuire Williams
